posts.post_content: Though the card itself is bad, I think it is still disrespectful that they've printed it so many times with the same art. Disrespectful to the community of players and to the core sets themselves, but also to the card. Magic is something I love, and I hate putting my cards into the trash can, no matter how bad they may be. But when I have twelve copies of a card that I don't need and that no one else wants, and I need room in my boxes, I actually need to get rid of them somehow...
posts.html:
Though the card itself is bad, I think it is still disrespectful that they've printed it so many times with the same art. Disrespectful to the community of players and to the core sets themselves, but also to the card. Magic is something I love, and I hate putting my cards into the trash can, no matter how bad they may be. But when I have twelve copies of a card that I don't need and that no one else wants, and I need room in my boxes, I actually need to get rid of them somehow...

posts.post_content:
For everyone saying this is free lifegain.   
It's not. It costs 2 mana and a cardslot in your deck. If you play it early, when it will be most effective, it will mostly cost you a turn as well. This card is completely useless unless you're building lifegain and making sure to profit from this, and even then, it's only mediocre at best.

posts.post_content: If they reprint this cycle in Magic 2013, they should definitely include a card named "Charm Golem" that becomes stronger for every type of charm that you control on the battlefield. Angel's Feather would give it flying, Demon Horn would give it Death Touch, Dragon's Claw would give it First Strike, Wurm's Tooth would give it Trample, and Kraken's Eye... no idea what that would do... scry? No idea what it's power or toughness would be or it's cmc, but it would be freaking hilarious to build a deck full of charms and this golem dude.
